main.name: David Grant
main.description: I eat, sleep and breathe React
main.bio: Hi there! I am David! My journey into coding began with the Meta Front-End Developer course, where I discovered a passion for building clean, user-friendly interfaces. Since then, I’ve been honing my skills in front-end development, with a strong focus on writing accessible, responsive, and efficient code. In addition to development, I’ve also studied the Google UX design Course and earned certifications in Google Digital Marketing and E-commerce plus Harvard's Python CS50. These experiences give me a broader perspective on creating products that not only work well—but truly connect with users. I'm excited to keep growing as a developer and contribute to meaningful, user-centered projects.

education.description: Multi-course program, featuring nine courses, that covers essential topics like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, and UX/UI design. The program emphasizes hands-on experience through practical projects and a capstone project, allowing learners to build a portfolio to showcase their skills.

work.title: Founder and CEO
work.description: Cloning all the apps possible. On the way to clone the world!

projects.title: Lime Scooter Clone (React Native)
projects.summary: Developed a full-featured mobile application mimicking the functionality of a Lime scooter rental service, demonstrating expertise in cross-platform development and seamless Backend-as-a-Service integration.
projects.tech used: React Native, TypeScript, Supabase, Mapbox API, Jest, Node.js, Android Studio, Expo
achievements: Built the application's user interface and client-side logic using React Native, ensuring compatibility across both iOS and Android platforms.
Integrated the Supabase platform to handle all backend services, including user authentication, real-time ride tracking, and managing scooter data.
Utilized the Mapbox API for crucial real-time mapping, location-based services, and precise calculation for locating and tracking scooters.
tools_and_testing: Disclaimer:** Built purely for demonstration of React Native/Mapbox/Supabase/Authentication skills; zero affiliation with the original brand.
The client-side was developed and tested using Android Studio.
Provided a direct download link (APK) for installation on Android devices, bypassing the need for developer tools.

projects.title: Uber Clone (React Native)
projects.summary: Mobile ridesharing app replicating Uber’s core features, built using React Native and deployed via Expo Go for seamless testing on Android and iOS.
projects.tech used: React Native, Tailwind CSS, Redux, React Native elements, React Navigation, React Native Maps, Figma, Google Maps APIs(Maps, Places, Directions, Distance Matrix, Google Places Autocomplete), Jest, Node.js, Expo, Android Studio
achievements: Real-time ride tracking with live map integration
Pickup/dropoff selection and route visualization using Google Places Autocomplete and Directions APIs.
Distance Matrix API for fare estimation based on trip distance and duration.
State management with Redux for handling user data, ride requests, and app state.
Developed a responsive UI with Tailwind CSS for a seamless user experience across devices.
Slick Introduction screen with animated logo and background image. Designed using Figma
Toggle switch for light and dark modes.
tools_and_testing: Disclaimer:** Built purely for demonstration of React Native/Google API skills; zero affiliation with the original brand.
The client-side was developed and tested using Android Studio.
Provided a direct download link (APK) for installation on Android devices, bypassing the need for developer tools.

projects.title: Netflix Clone (React JS)
projects.summary: Subscription-based video streaming interface that mimics Netflix’s user experience. Integrated Stripe for secure payments and deployed on Vercel.
projects.tech used: React, Next.js,  CSS3, Jest, Node.js, Firebase, Stripe API, TMDB API, Figma, Vercel,
achievements: Built the application's user interface and client-side logic using React, ensuring compatibility across both iOS and Android platforms.
User authentication and subscription management via Firebase, payment via Stripe API integration.
Responsive video card layouts with hover effects and dynamic content loading.
Slick Introduction screen with animated logo and background image. Designed using Figma
tools_and_testing: Disclaimer:** Built purely for demonstration of React Native/Firebase/NexstAuth/Stripe Payment API Integration kills; zero affiliation with the original brand.
Fully deployed on Vercel, demonstrating production-ready payment integration.

projects.title: Airbnb Clone (React, Next.js)
projects.summary: A full-stack accommodation booking app inspired by Airbnb, built with Next.js and deployed on Vercel for fast server-side rendering and global CDN performance.
projects.tech used: React, Next.js, Tailwind CSS, Mapbox API, Jest, Node.js, Vercel
achievements: Dynamic user interfacing within a Next.js framework with listings, search, and filtering
Intuitive calender date picker for booking availbility
Integrated Mapbox API for interactive location mapping and property visualization.
Responsive design using Tailwind CSS for optimal viewing across devices.
tools_and_testing: Disclaimer:** Built purely for demonstration of React/Tailwindcss/Mapbox skills; zero affiliation with the original brand.
Hosted live on Vercel, ensuring scalability and modern deployment practices.

projects.title: Little Lemon Restaurant (React JS)
projects.summary: Responsive web app for restaurant reservations, developed as a capstone for the Meta Front-End Developer Professional Certificate.
projects.tech used: React, CSS3, Figma, Jest, Node.js, Netlify
achievements: Table booking form with validation and state management using React hooks.
Accessibility-friendly layout and navigation for an inclusive user experience.
Dynamic menu and booking confirmation features.
Designed using Figma
tools_and_testing: Deployed on Netlify, with continuous deployment from GitHub.
Tested using Jest to ensure component functionality and reliability.

projects.title: Spotify (React, Next.js)
projects.summary: A responsive web application replicating the Spotify music streaming experience. Built with React and Next.js, the project integrates the Spotify Web API to fetch and display real music data, allowing users to browse artists, albums, and tracks with live search functionality. Designed for performance and user engagement, the app leverages server-side rendering and clean component architecture.
projects.tech used: React, Next.js, Typescript, Tailwind Css, Spotify Web Developer API, Jest, Node.js
achievements: Frontend: React, Next.js (server-side rendering for performance), Tailwind CSS for responsive design.
Search and browse functionality for songs, albums, and artists via Spotify API
Integrated NextAuth for user authentication and secure access to Spotify data.
Dynamic routing and server-side rendering with Next.js for improved SEO and load times.
tools_and_testing: Disclaimer:** Built purely for demonstration of React/Next.js utilizing Spotify Web developer API skills; zero affiliation with the original brand.

testimonials.text: Design is not just what it looks like and feels like. Design is how it works.
Every great developer you know got there by solving problems they were unqualified to solve until they actually did it.
